body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Environmental Factors               Geology and Landscape Dynamics        Mount Mageik is one of many active volcanoes within Katmai's boundaries. Volcanoes continue to shape Katmai's landscape, ecology, and history. NPS/M. Fitz            Geologic Formations: What rock is underneath your feet? How old is it? Find out here.           Physiography: Katmai is encompasses two distinct physiographical provinces.           Valley of Ten Thousand Smokes: Unique on the face of the earth, this 40 square-mile area so enthralled early explorers that they lobbied for the creation of Katmai National Monument.           Volcanoes: Over one dozen active, and many more dormant, volcanoes lie within Katmai’s boundaries.             Water: Katmai contains hundreds of miles of rivers and streams and hundreds of thousands of acres of lakes.             Weather and Climate: A subarctic climate and variable weather influences every living thing in Katmai.
title: Katmai National Park & Preserve: Environmental Factors
